ee1cb8986c0c.description: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same about us, wonder about what is different & embrace one another anyway without condition.
ee1cb8986c0c.name: This Glorious Mess

header.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
header.title: This Glorious Mess

ee1cb8986c0c.shortDescription: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same…

collectionHeaderMetadata.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
collectionHeaderMetadata.title: This Glorious Mess

paragraphs.text: Thank you so much for sharing this news with me Tre! I didn’t catch this on Medium and I’m so excited I’m speechless. I almost didn’t post this piece! I’m very grateful for Ms. Sass’s keen editor’s eye and for This Glorious Mess for sharing. And thank YOU Tre — your positive encouragement is important to me! ❤

paragraphs.name: a0aa
paragraphs.text: The fact that I have to explain my behaviour is deeply upsetting. I feel a visceral resistance to addressing any aspect of this mess, but I also know that moving from resistance to acceptance requires a constant acknowledgement of each thought related to that internal pull of repulsion. In other words, it’s not about pretending things didn’t happen, and it’s not about trying to just ‘let it go’. Quite the contrary, moving from resistance to acceptance requires the repeated act of sitting with the emotional and mental chaos, meeting each retaliation head on, and giving each thought space to express itself.

paragraphs.name: abaf
paragraphs.text: You know when you hit that threshold — that tipping point where “Fuck You” is burning the tip of your tongue?
There’s so much here
paragraphs.name: 79a0

paragraphs.text: I can relate to right now I might just go puke.
paragraphs.name: 36f3

paragraphs.text: It’s also pretty nice to not feel so alone at the moment so I thank you for that gift. The only thing here I wonder about is if you actually were who you are in those moments you think…

c0b85a210c45.title: I am late, but I hope I am on time.

paragraphs.text: I am late, but I hope I am on time. I remember the first thing I ever read of yours. It was in the Knob. I knew I would be in for a treat if I continued to read you. That was sometime ago now, several months and Cristina, you are beyond amazing.
paragraphs.name: 931a

paragraphs.text: This piece proves it. Haha! You got Cyborg riled up, that is a treat!

paragraphs.text: Hello, Cristina Matteis. Sassy wanted to make sure you knew your piece made the Humans Tab of Medium’s homepage. Congratulations, love! Thank you again for allowing us to host it. 💙

56339e7cb391.title: In writing, there is certainly a place for solitude and quiet self-reflection, but this community…

paragraphs.text: In writing, there is certainly a place for solitude and quiet self-reflection, but this community has proven to me time again how important it is to join forces, spread love, and make space for our tribe of writers and feelers. Especially here and Now. I’m grateful to be a part of this. And Tre, your feedback is Timeless :)
paragraphs.name: 5f56

paragraphs.text: WOHOO!! Go Cristina!!
paragraphs.name: fb09

2b7a99871e5a.title: I shouted several “YES’s” reading your response.

paragraphs.text: I shouted several “YES’s” reading your response. It’s quite amazing how much personal strength you can find inside yourself after connecting with others over a shared experience and the illumination others can bring to your own situation.

4866c882e5f.title: Cristina, I love that you wrote through this moment in the aftermath.

paragraphs.text: Cristina, I love that you wrote through this moment in the aftermath. I love that you laid, in printed verbs, your experience and the care that still reigns your choices and your perspective. I think your share here is beautiful. Thank you.
